title: Room 1: Chemical Clue Room
description: In town’s science archieve, some strange chemical reports have been found. But not many people are able to understand what DBPs are. Your mission is to decipher what DBPs are.

questions.question: What does DBP stand for?
questions.explanation: DBPs are chemicals formed when disinfectants like chlorine react with natural matter in water.
questions.learning_content: DBPs are unintended chemical by-products from disinfecting water.
questions.Clue: Think about what’s left behind after disinfecting water.

questions.question: When are DBPs most likely to form?
options: When chlorine reacts with organic matter
questions.correct_answer: When chlorine reacts with organic matter
questions.explanation: Chlorine disinfects water but reacts with leaves, soil, and other organic material to form DBPs.
questions.Clue: Disinfection reactions with natural stuff can cause unexpected results.

questions.question: Which of these is a common disinfectant that can cause DBP formation?
questions.explanation: Chlorine is commonly used to kill germs but also forms DBPs when it reacts with organic material.
questions.learning_content: Chlorine helps disinfect water but can also create harmful by-products.
questions.Clue: It’s the go-to chemical for killing germs in drinking water.

questions.question: Why are DBPs found more in treated water than in natural water sources?
options: DBPs are only added by factories
questions.explanation: Disinfection is meant to clean water, but this process can also create DBPs.
questions.learning_content: Disinfection helps safety, but also creates DBPs.
questions.Clue: Treated water is safer, but chemical reactions come with trade-offs.

questions.question: Which condition can increase DBP formation?
questions.explanation: More natural material in water increases chances for DBP formation when disinfectants are added.
questions.learning_content: More natural material = more DBPs if disinfectants are used.
questions.Clue: More stuff floating in your water = more reactions during treatment.
